intro: Cebatha sagittifolia, commonly known as the arrowleaf cebatha, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in the spring. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Cebatha sagittifolia thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas.
